ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
You are a 28-year-old woman, biologically female, of childbearing age. You are experiencing the following symptoms: first, you started noticing that seeing in dim light has become much harder, especially at night—you feel like your eyes struggle to see after sunset. Over the past couple of weeks, your eyes have become very dry and gritty, and you sometimes see small foamy spots or patches in the whites of your eyes, which worry you. Recently, you've also developed some open sores on the surface of your corneas, and your vision seems a little cloudy, especially when you wake up in the morning. These symptoms gradually worsened over the last month, and you're now concerned because your vision is becoming more impaired, and you feel increasingly uncomfortable with your eyes.
output:
THINKING: I should explain that my eyesight has gotten worse over time, especially in low light, and mention the eye discomfort and strange spots I've been seeing. I also want to include that it’s been ongoing 
ANSWER: Well, I’m a 28-year-old woman, and my eyes have been bothering me for like a month now. At night, I can barely see—everything just gets really blurry or dark, and it’s kind of scary because I’ve noticed I’m having trouble focusing. During the day, my eyes feel super dry, and I keep seeing these little foam-looking spots or patches in the white part. Recently, I even got some open sores on my corneas, and when I wake up in the morning, my vision is all cloudy, like I can’t see very clearly until I blink a lot. I don’t know what’s going on, but it’s making me really uncomfortable, and I’m worried I’m going to lose my sight or something.
